body: A crap! Why the hell was this done against release90???

As a rule of thumb (yes there will be exceptions) - changes should always go into master and can then be backported into a release branch. I reverted the push to `release90`.

I cherry-picked the changeset from this PR now into master.

@vieiro @emilianbold could you please have a look at this? This is still the aftermath of the release of netbeans 9.0. Lets just say, that the OASIS license raised some concerns when it is included by us. On the other hand, about fifteen years ago the same files were included into xml-resolver. So instead of refighting, I think it is better to work with the established code base of xml-resolver. 

I decided to stick with the data from maven central, but an alternative approach would be to fetch the "real" release data from apache, but I think we don't gain anything from that and maven central has a massive CDN, that I'd like to take advantage of as much as possible.

So, there appear to be (at least) two Travis CI checks failing:
-the rat check; I'd suggest to modify ".travis.yml", replacing the line:

>   - ant -quiet rat -Drat-report.haltonfailure=true
with

>   - (ant -quiet build-source-config && mkdir scratch && cd scratch && unzip -qq ../nbbuild/build/platform-src* && ant -quiet rat -Drat-report.haltonfailure=true && cd .. && rm -rf scratch)

That should ensure rat only checks what is in the default build in Travis.

Then there's a failure that some of the files are using different line endings than LF, I guess the easiest would be to simply change that.

I can try to work on these in the evening, if needed.

> I can try to work on these in the evening, if needed.

@jlahoda Could you please do it? I'll leave it to you. Thanks!

Hi! Thank you for the review and comments.
Requested changes have been made.
In addition to that, concept of UNKOWN version has been removed and replaced with exceptions. On second thought exceptions might be a better idea as they land in logs and do not hide problems which may occur should svn --version drastically change output format.
Ok. I will keep that in mind. Sorry about that.

Am Donnerstag, den 02.08.2018, 06:16 -0700 schrieb SirIntellegence:
> Ok. I will keep that in mind. Sorry about that.

I just reread my comment - it could have sounded rude, it was not meant
so. It was more directed to myself - I should have noticed before
pulling the PR in.
Looks good - thanks for taking care!

I noticed after merging: Please use the schema "[NETBEANS-XXX] MESSAGE" for the first line of the commit message in the future. XXX is the issue number and MESSAGE is the summary of the changeset. This was the jira integration can assoziate the git commit with the jira ticket. I hope you stay and fix some more issues :-)

I see no files with windows line endings and the check in the travis run also return 0 (the shell equivalent of true), so this looks good. The rat report problem is kind of expected.

In general the approach of @junichi11 is sound. We might merge and disable the rat test for now (instead of introducing a work around) -- the rat report needs to be worked, but getting things into master might be worth it.
Thank you for taking over it, @jlahoda ! I'll close this PR :)

It seems that failed the following:
```
unzip:  cannot find or open ../nbbuild/build/platform-src*, ../nbbuild/build/platform-src*.zip or ../nbbuild/build/platform-src*.ZIP.

No zipfiles found.

travis_time:end:026520c8:start=1533244571130458688,finish=1533244649794027092,duration=78663568404
^[[0K
^[[31;1mThe command "(ant -quiet build-source-config && mkdir scratch && cd scratch && unzip -qq ../nbbuild/build/platform-src* && ant -quiet rat -Drat-report.haltonfailure=true && cd .. && rm -rf scratch)" exited with 9
```
Great. Thanks a lot, @jlahoda !
I totally support consuming ASF dependencies on rely on their existing IP clearance.

Hi @matthiasblaesing ,
To clarify my understanding: we're removing these offending sources from our repo (that were not offending years ago  but are now) and instead download them from Maven Central (after some patching). If so this workaround seems good to me, as it's important to add these schemas to NetBeans.
@vieiro your summary is correct.

Hi @matthiasblaesing , 
This being so, I have no issues with mergin. 
Thanks very much for doing this!.

The changeset looks good. I build the full cluster successfully. I suggest to run the `AddFormLicense` tool from https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans-tools/tree/master/convert, that brings the rat report down to a more reasonable size. With or without that, the changeset can IMHO be merged.
It's possible this never made it into the release90 branch and so is not in the Apache NetBeans (incubating) 9.0 release.

@matthiasblaesing, I believe Geertjan already ran that on the branch. There are presumably many remaining files to be cleaned up, but hopefully the bulk of the conversions is already done.

Unless there are objections, I'll merge this tonight.

No, I forgot that we have the AddFormLicense tool! Will run it as soon as @jlahoda has done the merge. Looking forward to this being done, then we can see the remaining problems, and discuss them on the mailing list and also in the virtual meetup on Tuesday.

@dbalek could you please have a look whether this makes sense to you? The current behavior is a PITA in the oneline-editors (for example entering a condition for a breakpoint), as the line gets split and so you have to scroll each line/reassemble the line.
Seems to me that the PR also relicenses form files to Apache that had already been relicensed to Apache. Not sure if this is a problem though.
Like to know how the rat-report looks like afer this commit.
Rat report will be cut in half from about 1200 to around 600 unknown files.
Anyone have a reason not to merge this, or does anyone have comments of any kind?
@geertjanw There are duplicate license headers. Probably, the license header was added to files of other than the 2nd donation again.
That sucks. How do we add licenses only to the files that don't already have them?
This needs to be tweaked to only be run if no Apache license is already in the file: https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans-tools/blob/master/convert/src/convert/AddFormLicense.java
Closing, will send a new one with only the form files in the newly added modules relicensed.
Somehow Travis failed, does someone know why?

```
The job exceeded the maximum time limit for jobs, and has been terminated.
```
Restarted.
Same problem as before?
Applied review comments: Javadoc reworded, corrected. `checkedOn` value added, `@ActionState` can only be used as a value. XML layer attributes documented, ugly underscore removed.
OK, merging.

Looks fine. I reviewed the rewrite from XMLSyntaxSupport but I really don't remember what was the reason to change `if` to `while`; possibly a copy-paste error (it was rather a bulk change).
Thanks for patching.
Looks good, but you should change the commit message and the title of this PR like #651 if possible.

I meant that not adding but changing. Sorry I did not make it clear enough...

OK, We should squash and merge then should change the commit message. 

Thank you for your work, @thilina01 :)
Awesome!
Thank you for your great work!
It seems that there are unit test files. Did you run unit tests whether they success?

@junichi11 
ant -> success
ant tryme -> success
ant rat -> following failures

[rattotest] /home/thilina/github/incubator-netbeans/nbbuild/build/rat/enterprise.xml: 65 failures out of 65 tests
[rattotest] /home/thilina/github/incubator-netbeans/nbbuild/build/rat/ergonomics.xml: 1 failures out of 1 tests
[rattotest] /home/thilina/github/incubator-netbeans/nbbuild/build/rat/groovy.xml: 6 failures out of 6 tests
[rattotest] /home/thilina/github/incubator-netbeans/nbbuild/build/rat/not cluster.xml: 1 failures out of 1 tests
[rattotest] /home/thilina/github/incubator-netbeans/nbbuild/build/rat/php.xml: 21 failures out of 21 tests
[rattotest] /home/thilina/github/incubator-netbeans/nbbuild/build/rat/webcommon.xml: 31 failures out of 31 tests

===========

Examined all failures one by one and noticed everything is "Unapproved license....." only
If there is any other command I should run to test, please advise.

> ant -> success
> ant tryme -> success
> ant rat -> following failures

@thilina01 I don't mean these. 
e.g. 
`web.jsf/test/unit/src/org/netbeans/modules/web/jsf/refactoring/data/goldenfiles/ModificationsTest/gold-modifications.xml`
This file is used in 
`web.jsf/test/unit/src/org/netbeans/modules/web/jsf/refactoring/ModificationsTest.java`.
I meant that open the web.jsf module in NetBeans, then right-click ModificationsTest.java, run Test File.

In this case, if you add the license header, the test fails. So we don't have to add the license header. Instead, we have to add the file to rat-exclusions.txt.

Probably, you should check modules[1] one by one because this PR may be a cause of confusion...
Please also look at [2] and PRs of the 1st review e.g. #26 e.t.c. 
[1] https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/NETBEANS/2nd+Donation%3A+List+of+Modules+to+Review
[2] https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/NETBEANS/List+of+Modules+to+Review
@thilina01 Thanks a lot for your contribution!

In general looks good - I would however ask you not to add rat excludes, but use the "licenseinfo.xml" facitlity to declare the license for the file without modifying it. Please have a look at:

`xsl/licenseinfo.xml`

I think that should cover your usecase. The benefit is, that in the end the file can be traced to the license info and the rat exclusion is modular.
@matthiasblaesing Thank you for it :) I'll fix it. Should we also add image files there?
@junichi11 that would be great - it was for example done in: `/languages/licenseinfo.xml`
The same comment as in #662 applies
@matthiasblaesing OK, I see. I'll also do that :) Thanks!
OK, I'll fix.
@thilina01 I've created some PRs. Please also have a look at Matthias' comments ;)

@matthiasblaesing I've added the below to [2nd Donation: List of Modules to Review](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/NETBEANS/2nd+Donation%3A+List+of+Modules+to+Review)

"Please add a licenseinfo.xml instead of adding files to the rat-exclusion.txt. (e.g. see xsl/licenseinfo.xml)"
Nice conversation to understand the relicensing process :+1:
Sure, thanks.
@sdedic @rtaneja1 @arusinha I have made the necessary changes incorporating the review comments.
I had implemented in last commit review comments of @rtaneja1 @vikasprabhakar
I don't see any existing tests for the blame logic. I would add to them if they were there, but they aren't and I don't know how to write those kinds of tests.
I forgot to save before pushing the first one. Stupid mistake...
Yes, a test would be nice. That regexp pattern is still hard to read but at least your comment mentions the space/dot problem.
Thanks, looks good.
@geertjanw, can you please review and merge? Thanks.
Approved.

Here are some ideas: https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/NETBEANS -- and better to discuss on the mailing list than in this issue.

While I continue to find the behavior in this patch preferable on balance to the stock behavior, it is sufficiently controversial that it should just be considered on hold until I can find time to spend on a more ambitious alternate approach. I did not see an “experimental” label or similar, so just using the closest applicable label.

As a general comment: Swing can be used for GUI because you can expect an installed JDK to carry it. We can't currently depend on OpenJFX, as GPL-v2-CPE is not whitelisted by the apache foundation. There are discussions whether or not it should be usable, but at this time, JavaFX as a core dependency must be considered off-limits.
Change is good - thank you.
Change looks sane - and works :-) -- I prefer, that the author merged himself, I he/she can.

JSON does not support comments. So, should we add `.json` to nbbuild/rat-exclusions.txt?
I added json files to licenseinfo.xml.

I strongly disagree with removing the license header and not replacing it with the ALv2 one. It was argued, that "people" are scared by license headers even if they are as liberal as the ALv2 one. But in this case the license header is already present and till this day was not a problem, so I'd argue, don't go down the "exception" route, but just replace the GPL/CDDL header in the template file with a ALv2 one. As this is a freemarker template, it won't be present in the generated file, just in the template.
Same argument as in #675 (removed header instead of corrected).

Yes, I understand that(actually, a generated file does not have it.), but if we don't remove it, we get into the situation that some template files have the license header, the others don't have it. I don't think this is good... I think we should unify that. Probably, we discussed this in the 1st donation. The reason was "user visible", maybe. OK, I'll ask about this via the mailing list.
It was discussed and never resolved - so my way was to not change the status quo. Removing the header, although it was not a problem for several year just cements one opinion.
Thanks, @matthiasblaesing ! I'll add them to a licenseinfo.xml.

I sent it: https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/4be2dfa83506f69525828e12f8f3e44fbf5175efa8fcdb5110021be9@%3Cdev.netbeans.apache.org%3E

If anyone else does not have objections, I'll just change it ;)
This needs to be tested with updated nb-javac(with JDK 11 uptake).
Great, merging.

Hi,

Thank you very much for the reply.

Almost all Apache projects are based on Java/JDK, are they? This means,
that the Java license is acceptable to Apache policy.
Until September 2018, JavaFX is still part of Java. Then it becomes OpenJFX
<http://jdk.java.net/openjfx/> with the GNU General Public License, version
2, with the Classpath Exception
<http://openjdk.java.net/legal/gplv2+ce.html>.

Why the same license is acceptable from Apache for one product (Java) and
not acceptable to another (OpenJFX)?

I started using Java 20 years ago in 1998. The Java world has been waiting
for JavaFX for over 20 years. Swing and AWT were a failure for Java and
Desktop applications in the Java world. This was one of the serious
reasons, Microsoft .NET to overtake Java in many ways.

Why repeat the same mistake so many times?


Miro.
